uk.ac.leeds.ccg.geotools
Class GeoPoint

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--uk.ac.leeds.ccg.geotools.GeoShape
        |
        +--uk.ac.leeds.ccg.geotools.GeoPoint
All Implemented Interfaces:
IDReferenced, java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
ShapePoint
public class GeoPoint
extends GeoShape
implements java.io.Serializable

A double presision point. Typicaly used to store coordinates of at a high enough precision for geographic use.

See Also:
Serialized Form

contains

public boolean contains(GeoPoint p)
Tests to see if this point contains a given point
I feel that points can not contain anything however.
Overrides:
contains in class GeoShape
Parameters:
p - A GeoPoint to test
Returns:
boolean Always false, as points can not contain anything.

intersects

public boolean intersects(GeoShape s)
Tests to see if the two shapes intersect at all.

This returns true if s contains this point, or s is a point with identical coordinates to this point.

Overrides:
intersects in class GeoShape
Parameters:
s - The shape to test for intersection.
Returns:
A boolean, true if both shapes cross in some way.
Since:
0.7.1

getBounds

public GeoRectangle getBounds()
Gets the bounds for this point.
As points have position but no size, a GeoRectangle is returned with width and height set to 0
Overrides:
getBounds in class GeoShape
Returns:
GeoRectangle the bounds of this point

getPoints

public java.util.Vector getPoints()
Gets this point in a vector
Overrides:
getPoints in class GeoShape
Returns:
Vector a vecotor containg a clone of this point.

public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
tests if the specifed point is at the same location as this point returns true if x and y coordinates match
Overrides:
equals in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
boolean true if equal

add

public void add(GeoPoint p)
Aritmeticaly adds the specified point to this point. the X and Y values of both points are added and stored in this point.
Parameters:
p - The point to add to this point.
Since:
0.7.7.1 10/May/2000

subtract

public void subtract(GeoPoint p)
Aritmeticaly subtracts the specified point to this point. the X and Y values of point p is subtracted from those of this point.
Parameters:
p - The point to subtract from this point.
Since:
0.7.7.1 10/May/2000

divide

public void divide(double v)
Aritmeticaly divides the specified point by the given value. the X and Y values of this point are both divided by the specified value.
Parameters:
v - The double to divide the x and y values of this point by.
Since:
0.7.7.1 10/May/2000

multiply

public void multiply(double v)
Aritmeticaly multiplies the specified point by the given value. the X and Y values of this point are both divided by the specified value.
Parameters:
v - The double to multiply the x and y values of this point by.
Since:
0.7.7.2 9/June/2000
